item.description:
Hi Everyone,

As always; Saturday is preferred, and its looking OK but windy in certain areas.

I have chosen 10:45- 11:00 to generally arrive and apx 11:00 or so get unloaded..

11:15-11:30 +/- a few minutes am or so to get going upstream ..(info for those that want more specific's in my write ups ??? ).

 

 

Most of you already know this is a very unique location.

Here You can be just like the people on the SWAMP PEOPLE SHOW.

We can even use a magic marker and darken out some of your teeth to get the official look.

Then Reach into the water for a Frankenstein Fish, or pull up some green bottom salad goo for the BBQ.

 

 

 

For those of you that have not been here before, well i am not telling you anything REAL about it !

You just have to go and see for your self.

 

 

 

WEATHER for this location:

Close up view:

http://radar.weather.gov/Conus/northeast_loop.php

 

Prediction:

http://www.usairnet.com/cgi-bin/launch/code.cgi?Submit=Go&sta=KCEF&state=MA

 

National View:

http://radar.weather.gov/Conus/index_loop.php

---------

The SOURCE of this river must be a very special one, i have no idea why the water is the way it is, maybe it has a Mysterious COLD   Bubbing and cascading Spring ????

I guess WE have to try to go upstream and see where it bubbles up out of the ground if we can make it that far..

Its good excersize and you learn a little bit about water flow.

 

 

This is a very popular spot for many reasons - one that you will see yourself.

YOU MAY HAVE TO BE CREATIVE IN PARKING HERE IF THE PARKING LOT IS FULL.

i have faith in your ability to be creative and find a solution if its actually needed.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

The major part of the River is a low current FLAT water river, the only fast part is the upstream spot where we have to turn around and we maybe have to cross a tree or 2 along the way.

This upstream "Cant go no more spot"  is our stop destination for the first snack, then its head to the Godam Drop via a diversion into a hidden cove where the under fed Crocks and Ali-gators live.

A pass by Pirates cove is also in the plan --- some of the Pirates are below:


This is a perfect river for a "Recreational Yak"  and your "ocean cruisers" (you will learn some turning techniques here which you will need on the ocean anyway).

Its more of a sight seeing river and a place to enjoy slowly and deliberately, no need to paddle fast here.

~~~> Yes i know what the real name of the river is:

Ok, so i call it "Cold Spring River"  (The name of the street of the put in spot).

Meet and start to paddle around 11:15 am or so, If you are late, paddle upstream.

Keep in mind the drive time to the site..

----------------------------------------------------

The group pot luck after party will be "On Site" river side near the boat ramp with fellow Pirates sharing some CROCK.

----------------------------------------------------

The River Exploration starts (Left) "Upstream" from the boat ramp till we can't go any more in the WILD Jungle Environment.

On the way up take some pics, you will SEE why.

Then on the downstream return trip, go past  the boat ramp and head down stream to the SECRET opening for the coves and islands, from there its exit on down to the Godam Drop..etc..

There is a shore area for snacks near the Godam Drop for the return snack spot.

Barbie-Q or Picnic is after we return and after loading up till its time to go home.

_____________________________________________

GETTING THERE:

Use your GPS: 525 Cold Spring Rd Belchertown, MA 01007

or cross check some of your mapquest directions and look at your maps to the following:

From Hartford, CT: Please use the directions that follow only for a guide to your own specific directions.

Be aware there may be bridge work in certain areas or damage from Last Yearsstorm.

General directions from Hartford area:

Merge onto I-91 N toward Springfield- 25.9 mi Just North of Springfield city

Take exit x???? for I-291 E/US-20 EAST toward I-90/Mass.Pike EAST

go 0.2 mi follow signs for I-291 East and merge onto I-291 EAST/US-20 East

Continue to follow I-291 EAST for 5.0 mi

Take the I-90 EAST/I-90 W exit toward Masspike/Boston/Albany 0.3 mi

Merge onto I-90 EAST toward Boston Direction and go apx 11.5 mi Take exit 8 toward MA-32/US-20/Palmer/Ware 0.3 mi

Merge onto Palmer Ware Partial toll road Once under the Mass Pike bridge,

take a left onto HIGH st for 0.4 miles

Keep Right onto CHURCH st then take RIVER st for 1.4 miles

Take a left onto STATE st go apx 0.7 miles

Bear Right onto JIM ASS st for 1.1 miles

Keep strait on and Continue onto Bondsville Rd for 1.5 mi

Turn left at Cold Spring Rd and go apx 0.1 miles or over bridge and turn left into the parking lot,

Park so we can all fit... This is a small lot with apx 30 spaces max and its a popular spot so park where you can.

(The other alt route is I-84 to Stafford Springs and up 32..etc..)

OR Just follow your GPS: and maps.

 

''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''''

KAYAKS AVAILABLE:

The following Kayaks with paddles and life jackets are available for the put in site if reserved in advance:

Note: if you reserve a kayak and i take it all the way to the site and you do not show -- you will never join us again for any event again, these are my personal hobby boats and its asked you be sincere in showing up, besides i ask less than half of what a local shop charges and you get better equipment right at the event site.

Yes i will understand  traffic may cause you to be late and if i hear of of any traffic via my GPS or by other arriving members, then we usually wait a bit longer than normal.

Please get a GPS, or a GPS with traffic data is even better.

 

Boat use Doughnation is $20.00.

 

KAYAK #1:       Eddyline Wind Dancer Fiberglass/Kevlar, Red, Rudder Equipped 18' @ 24" wide.

This is an older expedition style sea kayak designed for rough sea conditions and heavy loads.

Highly stable (initial & secondary), heavy weight (52 LB).       
For almost any sized paddler apx (100 to 200 lbs) with beginner and up skills.

http://www.epinions.com/otdr_Kayaking_Touring_Sea-Eddyline-Wind_Dancer

RESERVED FOR TIFFANY

 

KAYAK #2:       Necky Eliza Plastic, Fire Color, Rudder Equipped 15'-3.5'' @ 22"wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak, moderate weight (49 LB) ladies kayak       
Small to Medium sized paddler (100 - 160 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the heavier model and largest cockpit of the Eliza series.    http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=706

RESERVED FOR KAT"S GUEST

 

 

KAYAK #3:     Necky Eliza Advanced Composite (Un Modified), Red and White, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak,  Light weight (45 LB) Ladies Kayak.

Small to Medium sized paddler (95 - 145 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the medium size cockpit of the Eliza series.

http://www.frontenac-outfitters.com/kayaks/one_boat.cfm?ID=702

RESERVED FOR MARY BETH

 


KAYAK #4:       Necky Eliza Composite Special Ultra Light Version

(Very Thin Fibreglass), Yellow, Skeg Version 15'-3'' @ 21" wide.

Transitional Recreation to Sea Kayak, Light weight (40 LB) Ladies Kayak.       
Small to Medium sized paddler (95 - 145 lbs) with Beginner and up skills.        
This is the lightest of the Eliza Series and also with the smallest cocpit.

http://playak.com/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&catid=5010:boats&id=2150:Eliza-Ultralite

http://www.neckykayaks.com/press_room/press_releases/eliza_paddlerspick/

AVAILABLE



KAYAK #5:    Wood Cedar Strip Night Heron by Guillemot Kayaks, Fixed Skeg 18' @ 20" wide.

Overall a stable and predictable Sea Kayak with a hard chine, low rocker Greenland style hull, heavy weight (50 lbs).

Greenland style Paddle available also if specifically REQUESTED.

http://www.cricketdesigns.com/greenland.htm .

Medium Sized Paddler (apx 100 - 200 Lbs) with NOVICE/INTERMEDIATE and up skills.

http://www.guillemot-kayaks.com/guillemot/node/30/detail

RESERVED BY KAT

 

KAYAK #6:        NDK Greenlander Pro,  Fiberglass, Red, Skeg Equipped. Greenland style, fast kayak for ocean crusing. 18' @ 21" wide,  heavy weight 50 lb

Full Greenland style sea kayak. Medium sized paddler (100-175 lbs) with  a MINIMUM of Intermediate to Advanced sea paddling skills needed for this boat.

http://www.maineislandkayak.com/ndk_greenlander.html#greenlanderpro

Reserved for     al-r ?

 

Ok I wish you all a good day..

al-r
item.how_to_find_us: I will be wearing an ORANGE "CROCK's &" Ali-Gator HUNTING hat at the parking lot-Boat ramp area

group.who: River and Shore Kayak-r's of CT

item.name: KAYAKING CROCK Safari @ COLD SPRINGS RIVER in MA Potluck BBQ on site.
